column4: hey guys, i portforwarded port 113 for irc identd to my ubuntu server but it still acts as if its not enabled
is there something i need to install to enable identd on ubuntu server?
modern clients can simulate or there are router boxes that simulate it sometimes..
it's an old relic that isn't very necessary..
what isnt necessary?
it's possible your router box is not allowing to port forward 113
its the port is forwarded to my ubuntu server already
the box may say its configured it's doing port forward to 113, but it may not be doing it because it's already doing some kind of identd on it's own
identd is basically something of a relic
the router does nothing but forward port 113.. there isnt anything else invloved, atleast i think so.. and i didnt do anything to my ubuntu server about identd
you should ask on #freenode what you're after about irc's..
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Identd identd is dead :/
they would know about identd
sounds like you're setting up a server that does ident checking
to understand what can simulate an ident response, you can ask on #freenode
sounds like you're setting up an irc server
port 113 is identd. You'll have to know about it. :) (read online)
installing oidentd fixed the issue.. now port 113 is Open and IRC sees it as enabled..
and the people at #freenode would know too :) lol.. whatever you're trying to do
identd is sort of dead, but tends to stick around with irc stuff
thats not what you said, you were talking as if my router is actually doing that and it doesnt
